info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 11:28AM EDT until April 7 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...
South Fork Licking River at Cynthiana affecting Harrison County.
.Heavy rain from the past several days will cause the river to rise.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...South Fork Licking River at Cynthiana.
* WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, A large section of city park floods. Water begins to back up in some streets in west side of town. At 22.0 feet, Intersections of Pearl and Locust, Poplar and Penn, and Poplar and Cromwell Alley flood. KY 36 (Pleasant Street) between Locust and W. Pike flood. KY 983 before Infirmary Road floods.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 21.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EDT Sunday was 21.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 7.6 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.9 feet on 05/04/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Monday afternoon at 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON
